intro: Salacia leptoclada, commonly known as the slender salacia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Salicaceae, which includes willows and poplars, though it is more closely related to other members of the genus Salacia. The plant is characterized by its climbing habit, with slender stems that can reach several meters in length. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture, while its small, yellowish flowers appear in clusters. Salacia leptoclada is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
